Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the power of the independent payment advisory board by comparing it to a "Medicare IRS" with the power to cut Medicare to pay for new government programs.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the independent payment advisory board has the power to cut Medicare.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the independent payment advisory board will use its power to cut Medicare in order to fund new government programs, without providing evidence for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the purpose and power of the independent payment advisory board that are not mentioned in the claim.
